title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Tuesday 2 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: patient recall after doctor tests positive for hiv .
tributes for two killed in belper crash .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates have finished for the day but we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: your comments : selby claims another world championship title
text: on facebook you 've been talking about mark selby 's back-to-back world championship titles .
dawn wilford said : `` well done to you mark leicester city is very proud of you . ''
gillian mudford wrote : `` what a great match well done mark you deserved it . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: fire crews rescue horse
text: firefighters have rescued a horse from a ditch near two dales this afternoon .
it was stuck in sydnope hill and specialist teams were on hand to help the horse down , along with a vet and its owners .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: paralympian encourages people to attend 'last competition ' on track
text: we told you earlier about richard whitehead hinting that the world championships in london could be his last .
sport has more on the story .
the paralympian made the comments during an interview with bbc radio nottingham and said : `` the world championships this year may be my last competition on the track .
`` that 's why i 'm encouraging as many people as possible to come down to the queen elizabeth stadium , because there 's going to be fireworks . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : staying mostly dry tonight
text: it 'll be mostly dry tonight with clear spells and variable amounts of cloud .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: thousands use leicester 's new a & e
text: almost 4,000 patients have now used the new emergency department at leicester royal infirmary .
it opened on wednesday last week - just in time for a busy bank holiday weekend .
richard mitchell from leicester 's hospitals has told the bbc that during this time the majority of patients were treated in a `` timely way '' .
he did however apologise to one patient who claims to have experienced delays .
mr mitchell said : six days after the new ed opened , i am really proud of the effort the team within ed and across all three hospitals sites are putting in to improve the patient experience . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in may
text: you 've been out and about in the east midlands today and you 've sent us some lovely photos to prove it .
this was taken by granniep in ashby de la zouch
this was sent in by reggie who was dog walking in hoveringham
and finally this lovely rural image was captured by redbrowny in belper
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: school named after derby student expanding
text: the mother of a derby woman who was killed by her former boyfriend in 2007 says a school set up in her memory in pakistan has been so successful , it 's going to be expanded into a college .

the school for poor and orphaned girls is named after 19-year-old halimah ahmed , who was an international relations student at nottingham trent university , and had dreams of becoming a un ambassador .
her family later set up the halimah trust charity .
this week , her mother dr zareen roohi ahmed told bbc radio derby fundraising has already started to extend the school .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : accident cleared on a6
text: in # leicester london road is clear now after the # accident at university rd , but regent road very busy and will take a few minutes to clear

documents.title: your questions : where was the nottingham mint ?
text: janet thompson has used your questions to ask : do we know where the medieval mint was in nottingham ?

i did n't even know there was one in the city , but after speaking to scott lomax , the city archaeologist , he said many people have speculated that it had been in bridlesmith gate - because that 's where some coins were found a long time ago - or somewhere else within the lace market .
he said there was a record of a mint being founded in nottingham in 928 but no other details have been found of where it was .
`` people have tried to find out but failed , '' he said .
`` it was almost certainly somewhere in the lace market or around there , but the mint itself has probably been built upon many times over the last 100 years , removing any evidence of it .
`` it 's one of those little mysteries i would love to find out . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: cash stolen from elderly woman 's bag
text: do these women look familiar to you ?
police want to speak to them after an 84-year-old woman had money stolen from her bag in leicester .
the pensioner withdrew a `` substantial amount '' of cash from a bank in belgrave gate on saturday 18 february but it was n't until she went into a shop that she found the money had gone .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen missing derby teen ?
text: police say they are `` growing increasingly concerned '' for 17-year-old courtney meynell-brookes who has gone missing from her home in alvaston .
the force said she was reported missing on 25 april and she had been in contact with her family `` intermittently '' by phone , but she has not been in touch since thursday .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: remains of newborn baby found
text: leicestershire police have confirmed the human remains found in the hinckley area on sunday were that of a newborn baby .
police said the investigation is in its early stages however an initial post-mortem examination was carried out yesterday .
further tests are now needed to determine the cause of death .
a 27-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of concealing a birth - she 's currently in hospital getting medical treatment .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cook & hameed available until july
text: cook & hameed available until july

documents.title: hiv doctor no longer working in nhs
text: the doctor at the centre of the patient recall is not now working in the nhs .
bosses said he had been working as a locum doctor when treating patients at the three hospitals between june 2010 and february 2015 .

in a statement the chesterfield royal hospital trust said it was `` perfectly safe '' for health workers to provide patient care and services if they are hiv positive but they need to `` adhere to all appropriate infection control procedures '' .
i assure patients and people in north derbyshire that chesterfield royal hospital is committed to making sure their care and treatment is safe .
as worrying as this issue sounds it is extremely unlikely the virus transferred to anyone during their treatment .
however , it is important we are open and honest about any issue that relates to people 's nhs care and they have the right to know about it . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: hiv doctor sparks patient recall
text: hiv doctor sparks patient recall

documents.title: security guard hurt while restraining armed robber
text: a security guard has been injured while detaining an armed robber outside a bookmakers in mansfield this morning .
a man wielding a knife went into the betfred bookmakers in market place at about 11:15 .
police said the security guard was taken to hospital but his injuries are not believed to be serious .
a 44-year-old man has been arrested on sus of robbery and wounding with intent in connection with the robbery .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: sheep stolen in derbyshire
text: a farmer in hatton has had 30 sheep stolen from his farm .
he visited his field on marston lane yesterday morning to find the animals were gone and there were `` fresh tyre marks '' on the field .
it 's thought to have happened between 10:30 on sunday and 11:00 yesterday .
police are appealing to anyone who might have seen any sus activity in the area .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bus pass elvis back in the building
text: despite having claimed earlier this year that he was no longer going to stand in elections , dave bishop a.k.a .
lord biro is back .
bishop , from nottingham , who has previously stood for the bus pass elvis party is standing for his new elvis and the yeti himalayan preservation party .
he is running in the nottingham city council sherwood by-election .

the other candidates in thursday 's election in the ward are carol boultby ( ukip ) , zeb brigham ( green party ) , barry holliday ( lib dems ) , william scott ( conservatives ) and adele williams ( labour . )
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : cricket pitch inspection
text: i 've been taking a look at the pitch at fischer county ground ahead of leicestershire v warwickshire this afternoon
author: Richard Rae
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: breakingpatient recall after doctor tests positive for hiv
text: hundreds of people have been advised to have a blood test after a doctor working in nottingham and chesterfield tested positive for hiv .
nottingham university hospitals nhs trust has written to 223 patients who were cared for by the doctor .
they have also set up a dedicated helpline for patients with questions or concerns .
another 120 patents who were treated at the chesterfield royal hospital nhs foundation trust , and 57 at the royal cornwall hospitals nhs trust , have also been contacted .
the risk that any patient has been infected by transmission of the virus from this doctor is extremely low .

transmission of the virus between an infected healthcare worker and a patient with an open wound can only occur if health workers themselves have an injury with bleeding when they are delivering patient care .
there is no evidence this happened to this doctor in any patient contact . ''
the doctor was employed through a locum agency and is no longer working for the nhs .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: classic e-type jaguar stolen
text: have you seen this jaguar ?
police have said it was stolen from a parking area outside donington park on saturday .
it happened between 10:50 and 18:50 .
it is a white jaguar e- type series 1 , manufactured in 1965 .
it 's worth a fair bit as well by the looks of it - prices seem to average around £ 200,000 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for body-in-suitcase murder
text: man jailed for body-in-suitcase murder

documents.title: cricket : play starts in one-day cup
text: play is underway at derby between the home county and the notts outlaws .
derbyshire are 93-0 ( 16 overs ) .
slow , even-paced surface not helping the notts pace attack at all .
author: Dave Bracegirdle
BBC Radio Nottingham commentator

documents.title: weather : staying cloudy this afternoon
text: it will be increasingly cloudy however there 'll still be a few bright spells this afternoon before a few showers arrive later .
highs of 15c ( 59f )
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : resort wants to move on from madeleine 's disappearance
text: nearly 10 years after the disappearance of madeleine mccann in portugal , it 's claimed many people living in and around the resort of praia da luz are unhappy with the continuing media spotlight .
three-year-old madeleine from rothley went missing from her parents ' holiday apartment on 3 may 2007 .
these defaced road signs can now be seen in the village
the publisher of an english language newspaper in portugal said after such a high profile case , many residents want to move on .
kate and gerry mccann have spoken to the bbc about the upcoming anniversary and say they still have hope their daughter will be found
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: group handed money to help boost town
text: a community group has been awarded £ 10,000 funding to help revive bulwell town centre .
the we love bulwell group has been given the cash after a review led by shopping expert mary portas found it was one of two places in nottingham that needed a boost from the government .
money will be used for a variety of projects in the area , while a music event and a local newspaper have already been launched and new seating and plants have been put in place .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: woman critical after crash that killed daughter and partner
text: a woman is still in hospital this morning following the car cash in belper that killed her daughter and partner .
she was driving the car that crashed into railings on kilbourne road early on sunday morning .
her 28-year-old partner and six-year-old daughter were both killed .
police said the 22-year-old woman is in a critical but stable condition at the queen 's medical centre in nottingham .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city mayor plans leicester mural to honour mark selby
text: leicester city mayor sir peter soulsby has said he is `` up for suggestions '' for a place to put a mural to celebrate mark selby 's world snooker championship win .
a number of murals were painted around the city last year celebrating leicester 's premier league title win and some of leicester tigers ' legendary players ( below ) .
now sir peter wants to honour three-time world champion selby in a similar way .
he said : `` a mural for his tremendous achievement is something i 'd like to get on with . ''
selby , from leicester , won his third world snooker championship last night , defeating john higgins 18-15 at the crucible theatre in sheffield .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car crashes into market harborough house
text: a car crashed into a house in market harborough over the weekend
the fire service said they were called to knoll street on saturday afternoon to assess the structure of the building - they found it to be safe .
luckily no one was hurt either .
police told me they were called to the scene but they 're not investigating the incident and no one has been arrested .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: skate park damaged by vandals
text: a skate park in nottingham has been vandalised over the weekend .
firefighters were called early on saturday morning to the hook nature reserve off holme road , lady bay after a fire was started underneath one of the skate ramps .
a red swastika was also spray painted on another ramp - but was later painted over and vandalised again .
sam who uses the park with his friends said the damage was `` frustrating '' .
he said : `` it 's always a nice environment for people to be in and you want to come here , but now we are starting to stay away . ''
he said there had been vandalism in the past and teenagers who use it are often blamed .
nottinghamshire police said it is treating the fire as an arson attack .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : faulty lights causing delays
text: traffic signals are still out at western blvd / wollaton rd junction ( crown island ) - engineers are working to get them restored asap .

documents.title: arrested woman still in hospital
text: we 've spoken to leicestershire police again this morning about their investigation after human remains were found in a bag in hinckley .
they 've told us they can not say any more for `` operational purposes '' but the woman arrested on sus of concealing a birth is still in hospital .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : life on the canal
text: how would you feel about living on a canal ?
it certainly does n't float my boat but according to the canal and river trust more and more people are doing it .
they claim 10 years ago , 10 % of boats on the waterways were used as `` primary residences ''
now they claim that number has more than doubled to 26 % .
this is beryl in mountsorrel who 's been doing it for nearly 50 years
she told me : `` i started off canoeing then went to a 68ft narrow boat .
it 's very much like a miniature house inside .
`` i like the sense that if you 've got neighbours that you do n't get on with or you find you do n't like the area , it 's possible to move .
`` also it 's nice to go out travelling - you can get all over the country .
i 've been up to yorkshire and down to gloucester .
i 've been to london a few times . ''
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: to open garden at flower show
text: we 've already told you that chatsworth house is hosting its first ever rhs flower show next month .
it 's going to be huge and they 've already sold over 70,000 tickets .
the exciting news is that bbc radio derby is going to have a garden there too , and we 're asking for your help to do it .
we want the garden to represent our region and reflect something synonymous with the area , such as a landmark or an industry and we want your ideas .
the plot size is 8m x 8m and you 've got until next monday to send us your suggestions via email or text 81333 .
let your imagination run wild !
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: tributes left for crash victims
text: tributes have been left at the scene of a fatal car crash in belper over the weekend where a six-year-old girl and a 29-year-old man died .
a 22-year-old woman is also in hospital .
it happened on kilbourne road at around 01:30 on sunday .
tom reith lives nearby and told bbc radio derby he was woken up by the noise and then saw the wreckage .
derbyshire police are appealing for anyone with dashcam or cctv footage showing the crash to contact them .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: whitehead talks about retirement speculation
text: he 's a paralympic legend , a two time gold medallist , world champion in the t42 200m and european champion , but could richard whitehead be about to hang up his blades ?
he 's told bbc radio nottingham over the weekend that this year 's world championships might well be his last competition , although he has n't made a final decision yet .
`` it will be a big competition for me and may be my last competition on the track maybe , '' he said .
`` the retirement question has been put out there a lot but the decision has not been made yet . ''
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: may day at calke abbey
text: i went to calke abbey in derbyshire for the first time yesterday - here are a few of my photos
send us your photos from the bank holiday weekend by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work starts to renovate and restore derby cathedral
text: the pews are being removed , the organ is being restored and the 1930s floor at derby cathedral is being lifted and replaced - all to allow a greater study of the building 's origins .
it 's all part of a £ 2.5m restoration project which the cathedral hopes will renovate the building and give them more knowledge about the cathedral 's history .
the work will take about five years to complete in time for the cathedral 's 300th anniversary .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: cricket : derbyshire v nottinghamshire later
text: derbyshire host nottinghamshire in the one day cup later hoping for back-to-back wins in the competition .
it comes after the falcon 's thrilling victory over northants on sunday where shiv thakor hit a career-best 130 and he 'll be eyeing up another decent score today .
derbyshire have named a 14-man squad for today , calling up academy pair matt critchley and fellow spinner hamidullah qadri .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: 'massive congestion ' on soar valley way
text: accident on soar valley way towards fosse park causing massive congestion ring road back to welford rd , leicester rd back to little glen rd
is it clear now .
planning best route to m1 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hundreds re-enact english civil war
text: newark stepped back to the 17th century yesterday as the town held a festival to relive the end of the first english civil war .
the nottinghamshire town played a pivotal role in the war and the event was part of a living history festival at newark castle .
yesterday 300 re-enactors from 17 different regiments across the uk took part in a pitched battle and fired muskets in the market square .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: expect some delays in city centre from this morning
text: a reminder that major roadworks start in nottingham city centre today .
they 'll affect canal street and london road between 09:30 and 15:30 every day for the next six to eight weeks as part of the £ 250m redevelopment around the broadmarsh shopping centre .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch : selby wins world championship title
text: a huge congratulations to mark selby who won the world snooker championship last night
i stayed up past my bedtime to watch the `` jester from leicester '' beat john higgins 18-15 in the final .
this was the moment he did it
selby is now only the fourth player to claim back-to-back titles in the modern era .
here 's what he said about the achievement
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'human remains ' found in bag
text: a woman has been arrested on sus of concealing a birth after a bag containing what is believed to be human remains were found near hinckley .
police said the 27-year-old , from leicestershire , is `` receiving appropriate medical treatment in hospital '' .
officers said they are in the early stages of their investigation , which was launched at the weekend .
a post-mortem examination has not yet taken place .
author: Andy Trigg
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning east midlands - i hope you all enjoyed the bank holiday weekend .
sandish shoker and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
